stream_context.summary: Kaze iterates on Course 14, a futuristic "space-city" level: finishing first-star platforming, experimenting with reflective walkways, lighting that pulses with the floor, and planning a gramophone-shaped concert hall connected by a flying "space taxi." Zeina’s mutant-Yoshi boss sketch, new flying-car vehicles, and shy-guy behavior across Acts are discussed while Kaze debugs custom shaders and explains rendering code.

development_findings.summary: Platforming for the first star in Course 14 is done; current focus is polishing visuals and world layout.
development_findings.quote: We got the platforming for the first star done—we’re still working on the visuals right now.

development_findings.summary: A gramophone-shaped concert hall will anchor one side of the city, linked by an un-jumpable gap crossed via a player-rideable space taxi.
development_findings.quote: I want the concert hall to be like here, and then I want there to be a space taxi going between these two. This is supposed to be a gap you can’t jump.

development_findings.summary: Floor tiles will glow and pulse; Mario’s lighting will sync with that pulse for dramatic effect.
development_findings.quote: We’ll have the floor pulsate the light, and then Mario lights up depending on how much the floor is lit up.

development_findings.summary: Zeina provided concept art for a mutant-Yoshi boss; design work proceeds from her sketch.
development_findings.quote: This was her idea for the mutant Yoshi—that’s the boss enemy here.

development_findings.summary: Shy Guys hide indoors during Act 1; after the boss is beaten (Act 2) they emerge and pilot flying cars, unlocking new traversal.
development_findings.quote: In the first act you can’t really get anywhere because all the Shy Guys are scared… during the second act… they’re gonna drive these cars… at that point you will be able to get around the level.

development_findings.summary: Kaze’s reflection wall uses a camera-based translation matrix shader; he demonstrated the code live.
development_findings.quote: What I’m doing is… taking the render matrix and generating a matrix that takes the Lakitu camera position.

development_findings.summary: A crash wiped shader progress mid-stream, highlighting stability issues in the toolchain.
development_findings.quote: Ah, it crashed?!… we lost a good bit of progress there.

development_findings.summary: Complex dynamic shadows are intentionally avoided; adding them in one area would force a full-game overhaul.
development_findings.quote: If I add complex shadows in one place, I need them everywhere, and that’s going to be so much work.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is skeptical of a PC port; custom shaders likely won’t render correctly and he will not maintain it. Alexado may attempt a separate repo.
development_findings.quote: Personally, I am not doing shit. I have nothing to do with the PC port… if I could snap my fingers and the PC port would be out of existence, I would.

context_findings.summary: Kaze enjoys playful criticism but dislikes seeming like a bully; he wants others to defend what he insults.
context_findings.quote: I like hating on things, but I don’t like if other people join me… then I feel like a bully.

context_findings.summary: Efficiency is his top work value; unresolved tasks wait only on external dependencies.
context_findings.quote: I work as efficiently as possible and that’s really the only thing I care about.

context_findings.summary: Since 2022 he holds a full-time programming job alongside ROM-hack work; RTYI is now a side/second full-time job.
context_findings.quote: In 2022, I got a job as a programmer as well, so now I also work as a programmer.

context_findings.summary: Monthly YouTube income was ~$940; $500 goes to his editor, illustrating tight finances.
context_findings.quote: We made $940; I had to pay my editor like $500… there’s just not really much money in ROM hacking.

context_findings.summary: Repeated PC-port questions frustrate him; individual askers don’t realize frequency.
context_findings.quote: The individual people asking probably don’t know that you’ve already been asked a million times.

biobak.summary: Polishes Kaze’s models, suggests new ideas and concepts; receives modest pay.
biobak.quote: Biobak goes over my models after I’m done and polishes them up—brings a lot of ideas.

badub.summary: Composes the game’s music; Kaze states he cannot handle music himself.
badub.quote: Yeah Badub is doing the music—I can’t do music at all.

zeina.summary: Drew the initial concept art for the mutant-Yoshi boss featured in Course 14.
zeina.quote: Zeina did some drawing—this was her idea for the mutant Yoshi.

key_stories.title: Designing the Space-City Walkway
key_stories.summary: Kaze experimented with reflective floor tiles and dynamic lighting to create an otherworldly bridge in Course 14.
key_stories.challenge: Find a visually striking yet N64-feasible way to depict a glass walkway over space.
key_stories.process: Used a moving star-texture reflection, custom movie lights, and shader matrices tied to camera position; adjusted after crash.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on pulsating floor tiles that illuminate Mario, with lights now pointing correctly.
key_stories.key_quote: Now Mario is being lit up by the light as intended.

key_stories.title: Shy Guy Transit System
key_stories.summary: The level’s progression hinges on shy guys who unlock transportation after their fear is resolved.
key_stories.challenge: Gate player movement without invisible walls.
key_stories.process: Narrative structure: Act 1 shy guys hide, making gaps untraversable; defeating the mutant Yoshi boss convinces them to pilot flying cars.
key_stories.outcome: Flying-car model roughed in; mechanic planned for Act-based unlock.
key_stories.key_quote: After you beat the boss, the Shy Guys are out and they’re gonna drive these cars… at that point you will be able to get around the level.

key_stories.title: The PC-Port Debate
key_stories.summary: Chat repeatedly pressures Kaze for a native PC version; he resists and clarifies misconceptions.
key_stories.challenge: Community demand for features Kaze sees as unnecessary or harmful.
key_stories.process: Explains that RT64 emulation already offers alleged benefits; emphasizes shader incompatibility; allows external volunteer to try.
key_stories.outcome: Alexado may pursue separate repo; Kaze remains uninvolved.
key_stories.key_quote: If I had the ability to just like snap my fingers and the PC port would be out of existence, I would.
